marketNews.title: GIIAS Sluggish, Car Sales in July 2025 Weak
marketNews.content: Gaikindo noted that car wholesales in July 2025 only reached 60,552 units. Although increasing by +5% MoM, this figure is still down -18% YoY, not much different from the annual decline in the last 2 months (May 2025: -15% YoY, June 2025: -23% YoY). For context, wholesales in July 2025 coincided with the GIIAS 2025 exhibition held from July 24 to August 3, 2025 (GIIAS 2024: July 18-24, 2024). This result brings wholesales for 7M25 to 435,390 units (-10% YoY), equivalent to only 48-58% of Gaikindo's 2025 target range of 750,000-900,000 units (vs. 7M24: 56% realization for 2024). The monthly increase in industry sales is generally driven by Japanese brands, although yearly sales figures are still declining. Among Japanese brands, only Suzuki (+11% YoY, +22% MoM) posted positive annual sales growth in July 2025, driven by sales of the Fronx. For Astra International (ASII), Toyota sales were recorded at 18,905 units (-30% YoY, +6% MoM), while Daihatsu was 10,451 units (-25% YoY, +12% MoM). Combined, these two main ASII brands booked annual decline (-28% YoY, +8% MoM) and were worse than the industry realization (-18% YoY, +5% MoM). Meanwhile, we highlight the sales of Chinese brands - such as Chery and BYD+Denza - which show weakening momentum with a monthly sales decline, although they are still growing annually. Among Chinese brands, only Wuling experienced a monthly sales increase in July 2025, although this was more due to the low-base effect.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway - Auto Industry Competition and ASII Strategic Review
marketNews.content: We assess that the price war - reflected in the launch of the BYD Atto 1 priced at ~200 million rupiah - is causing consumers to adopt a wait and see approach, potentially impacting car sales, especially in the electric vehicle segment dominated by Chinese brands. In the 2Q25 earnings call, ASII management stated that intensified competition along with the price war from Chinese brands could put pressure on ASII's margins, particularly in the greater Jakarta area which is most affected by this competition. However, given the market's already low expectations for automotive sales, we assess that ASII's stock performance could also be affected by the developments of the strategic review currently being undertaken by the company.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia's Retail Sales Forecast and China CPI Data
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia projects retail sales in July 2025 will grow +4.8% YoY, although it is projected to contract -4% MoM in line with the end of the holiday period and collective leave. In June 2025, retail sales were recorded at +1.3% YoY and -0.2% MoM (vs. May 2025: +1.9% YoY, -1.3% MoM), lower than Bank Indonesia's expectation which anticipated growth of +2% YoY and +0.5% MoM. China's national statistics bureau noted that the Consumer Price Index (CPI) in China was flat on an annual basis in July 2025 (vs. June 2025: 0.1% YoY inflation), exceeding consensus expectations which predicted deflation of 0.1% YoY. Monthly, inflation reached 0.4% MoM (vs. June 2025: -0.1% MoM deflation), exceeding consensus expectations at 0.3% MoM. Core inflation reached 0.8% YoY (vs. June 2025: 0.7% YoY inflation), marking the highest level in the last 17 months.

marketNews.title: ESDM Minister on Coal Production Decline and B50 Biodiesel Target
marketNews.content: The Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, stated on Monday (11/8) that national coal production during 1H25 only reached 357.6 million tons (-12% YoY), equivalent to ~48.3% of the 2025 target of ~739.7 million tons. The Director General at the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources, Eniya Listiani Dewi, on Monday (11/8) reaffirmed that the government plans to implement the B50 biodiesel mandate in 2026, although it is highly unlikely to start in January 2026. Furthermore, it is not yet known when the trial for this policy will begin. The Indonesian Biofuel Producers Association estimates that the B50 biodiesel mandate will likely require up to 19 million kiloliters of palm oil fuel per year. For comparison, the government has allocated 15.6 million kiloliters of palm oil fuel this year for the B40 program, an increase from the 13.2 million kiloliters allocated for the B35 program in 2024.

marketNews.title: Investor Preference for the Healthcare Sector
marketNews.content: "The potential for industry growth from the demand side is also supported by developments on the supply side - both in physical infrastructure and medical personnel." - amarbeatrice

tickerNews.title: Controller of WIFI Buys Shares Worth IDR 86.7 Billion
tickerNews.content: WIFI: The controller of Solusi Sinergi Digital, PT Investasi Sukses Bersama, purchased approximately 30.1 million WIFI shares at an average price of 2,880 rupiah per share on August 8, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 86.7 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the direct ownership stake of PT Investasi Sukses Bersama in WIFI increased from 53.65% to 54.22%.

tickerNews.title: KRYA Plans Capital Injection into Electric Motorcycle Company ECGO
tickerNews.content: KRYA: Bangun Karya Perkasa Jaya plans to conduct a capital injection into PT Green City Traffic amounting to approximately 10.4 billion rupiah, bringing KRYA's ownership in the company to 51%. PT Green City Traffic is an electric motorcycle company with the ECGO brand. KRYA stated that in the last 7 years, ECGO has sold more than 10,000 electric motorcycles in Indonesia. KRYA explained that after this transaction is completed, the company will officially enter the electric vehicle business. Previously, KRYA, along with its new controller, targeted replacing approximately 900,000 existing motorcycle taxi units in Indonesia with electric motorcycles over the next 5 years.

tickerNews.title: DATA Shareholder Increases Direct Ownership
tickerNews.content: DATA: A shareholder of Remala Abadi, Verah Wahyudi S. Wong, purchased approximately 1.1 million DATA shares at an average price of 1,790 rupiah per share on August 8, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 2 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the direct ownership stake of Verah Wahyudi S. Wong in DATA increased from 40% to 40.08%.

tickerNews.title: PPRI Shareholder Increases Direct Ownership
tickerNews.content: PPRI: A shareholder of Paperocks Indonesia, Budi Aditya Erna Mulyanto, purchased approximately 9.5 million PPRI shares at an average price of 218 rupiah per share on August 8, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 2.1 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the direct ownership stake of Budi Aditya Erna Mulyanto increased from 13.69% to 14.57%.

tickerNews.title: BULL Plans Private Placement up to 1.4 Billion New Shares
tickerNews.content: BULL: Buana Lintas Lautan plans to carry out a private placement of up to approximately 1.4 billion new shares with a dilution effect of up to 9.09%. The exercise price has not been announced, while the fund acquisition will be used for business development in the form of fleet development and/or working capital increase. BULL explained that the company already has 1 potential investor for this corporate action, namely a non-affiliated company from Hong Kong named Fortune Street Limited. This plan will be discussed at the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPSLB) on September 15, 2025.

tickerNews.title: PADI Plans Rights Issue for Working Capital Funding
tickerNews.content: PADI: Minna Padi Investama Sekuritas plans to hold a rights issue of up to approximately 2.3 billion new shares, with the funds raised intended for working capital. The exercise price has not been announced. This plan will be discussed at the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPSLB) on September 17, 2025.
